Nice meme but ANX is only considered EU becasue they got out of groups. If they played like INTZ they would still be wild cards.

no they actually are part of europe, not the union directly but are part of and considered European due to agreements ranging from trade to humanitarian, now IF they won if anyone shouts about EU won worlds, they didn't as by Riot they are considered Russia, not EU as they ar not in the EU LCS but the location of Russia is in europe, thats all i meant not actually considering them a part of the LCS as they are not and thats how regions obviously are names/categorised.
Like 70% of Russia is in Asia... how are they EU?? Culturally?

The part in Asia is largely empty. 

Geographically speaking, Europe part of the continent is till Ural mountains. All the populous regions of Russia is on western side of Ural mountains. This makes majority of Russian economy European.

thus they are considered to be in Europe, they ar not part of the union but are part of Europe.

I am fully aware of Russia's status as a member of the EU.

The fact is they they qualified as a Wild Card team.
This wouldn't be the first time C9 beat a Korean team, or a Samsung team for that matter.
I have faith.

GG

Had them number 2... You don't watch match pro play out of the west? The casters/analyst are extremely biased towards their region. The issues is Riot tries to hype up the West when they don't deserve it. Honestly, I think they do it more for investors than actual analysis.

If Riot was trying to pull in investors, they would do a few things they are not doing.
1- Release their stranglehold on the competitive scene (excluding parts of Asia)
2- Investigate ways to slow down the turnover rate for pro league players.
3- Do away with the relegation system. This is a big one, and probably the main reason we don't see more big money coming into LoL, like the 76'ers acquisition of Dignitas + Apex. In the NBA (sticking with basketball for the sake of the 76'ers tie-in) once you have bought in to the league, you are guaranteed your spot. No matter how badly you do, you are still allowed to stay. This makes buying an NBA team a relatively safe financial investment, because even if you do poorly, the money machine will not die. In the LCS and some other circuits of LoL, a team that does badly gets relegated to challenger / challenger equivalent and becomes much less visible, reducing or even destroying the earning potential. This makes a LoL team a very risky financial investment. This is unfortunate, because LoL is by far the most watched scene in ESports; as such it should be a secure gateway for big money to enter ESports, find a foothold, and expand into other games.
Look at NRG, Shaq himself bought in to LCS (with other investors), got some solid players but did poorly for 2 splits then got booted. Huge financial loss. Now look at the 76'ers buy in - if they do poorly, that team (LoL Team) is GONE, and they are sinking LOADS of money in. Meanwhile, the 76'ers (NBA Team) have made a name for themselves by being easy wins for other NBA teams, despite repeated acquisitions of great talent, and they get to stay, figure out a formula, and rebuild.


Just a few thoughts, sorry for the essay.
**TL:DR** - If Riot really wanted investors, there is a bunch of shit they should be fixing. But they aren't, so they clearly don't care for more investors.

1) They can control the competitive scene; the issue is the have monopolized the profit. It's not the same thing.

2) A big part of turnover is what makes it popular; anyone can do it. So, at anytime you can be replaced b/c of incoming talent. Another issue to turnover is salaries. Players can make more money through boosting and streaming than playing professional (that's back to number 1).

3) The relegation system does not deter investors. I'm sure you are aware of how Soccer/football leagues work? While also being in every region. They are ran with relegation systems and have billions coming in. The issue goes back to point 1.  You can still profit when being relegated through "parachute" payments from tv deals.

Soccer/Football leagues are the model for esports to follow due to global competition and fan bases.

You are correct about Soccer / Football using these models.

However, you can't really expect that to work for something that isn't already established and widely respected.

As much as it sucks for it to be this way, many people still laugh at ESports.
Many still laugh at Soccer / football.. what's your point?

People within the sports community laugh at it for various reasons.

However, ESports have yet to earn the respect that traditional athletics have. This is a simple, unfortunate fact.
